item.title: Deuteronomy 1
item.description: v1 These are the words which Moses spoke to all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah opposite Suf, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.

item.title: Deuteronomy 2
item.description: v1 Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea, as Yahweh spoke to me; and we encircled Mount Seir many days.

item.title: Deuteronomy 3
item.description: v1 Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan.

item.title: Deuteronomy 4
item.description: v1 Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and to the ordinances which I teach you, to do them; that you may live, and go in and possess the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, gives you.

item.title: Deuteronomy 5
item.description: v1 Moses called to all Israel, and said to them, “Hear, Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in your ears today, that you may learn them, and observe to do them.

item.title: Deuteronomy 6
item.description: v1 Now these are the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh your God commanded to teach you, that you might do them in the land that you go over to possess;

item.title: Deuteronomy 7
item.description: v1 When Yahweh your God brings you into the land where you go to possess it, and casts out many nations before you–the Hittite, the Girgashite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite–seven nations greater and mightier than you;

item.title: Deuteronomy 8
item.description: v1 You shall observe to do all the commandments which I command you today, that you may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers.

item.title: Deuteronomy 9
item.description: v1 Hear, Israel! You are to pass over the Jordan today, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourself, cities great and fortified up to the sky,

item.title: Deuteronomy 10
item.description: v1 At that time Yahweh said to me, “Cut two stone tablets like the first, and come up to me onto the mountain, and make an ark of wood.

item.title: Deuteronomy 11
item.description: v1 Therefore you shall love Yahweh your God, and keep his instructions, his statutes, his ordinances, and his commandments, always.

item.title: Deuteronomy 12
item.description: v1 These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess all the days that you live on the earth.

item.title: Deuteronomy 13
item.description: v1 If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you, and he gives you a sign or a wonder,

item.title: Deuteronomy 14
item.description: v1 You are the children of Yahweh your God. You shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.

item.title: Deuteronomy 15
item.description: v1 At the end of every seven years, you shall cancel debts.

item.title: Deuteronomy 16
item.description: v1 Observe the month of Abib, and keep the Passover to Yahweh your God; for in the month of Abib Yahweh your God brought you out of Egypt by night.

item.title: Deuteronomy 17
item.description: v1 You shall not sacrifice to Yahweh your God an ox or a sheep in which is a defect or anything evil; for that is an abomination to Yahweh your God.

item.title: Deuteronomy 18
item.description: v1 The priests and the Levites–all the tribe of Levi–shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel.

item.title: Deuteronomy 19
item.description: v1 When Yahweh your God cuts off the nations whose land Yahweh your God gives you, and you succeed them and dwell in their cities and in their houses,

item.title: Deuteronomy 20
item.description: v1 When you go out to battle against your enemies, and see horses, chariots, and a people more numerous than you, you shall not be afraid of them; for Yahweh your God is with you, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.

item.title: Deuteronomy 21
item.description: v1 If someone is found slain in the land which Yahweh your God gives you to possess, lying in the field, and it isn’t known who has struck him,

item.title: Deuteronomy 22
item.description: v1 You shall not see your brother’s ox or his sheep go astray and hide yourself from them.

item.title: Deuteronomy 23
item.description: v1 He who is emasculated by crushing or cutting shall not enter into Yahweh’s assembly.

item.title: Deuteronomy 24
item.description: v1 When a man takes a wife and marries her, then it shall be, if she finds no favor in his eyes because he has found some unseemly thing in her, that he shall write her a certificate of divorce, put it in her hand, and send her out of his house.

item.title: Deuteronomy 25
item.description: v1 If there is a controversy between men, and they come to judgment and the judges judge them, then they shall justify the righteous and condemn the wicked.

item.title: Deuteronomy 26
item.description: v1 It shall be, when you have come in to the land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, possess it, and dwell in it,

item.title: Deuteronomy 27
item.description: v1 Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying, “Keep all the commandment which I command you today.

item.title: Deuteronomy 28
item.description: v1 It shall happen, if you shall listen diligently to Yahweh your God’s voice, to observe to do all his commandments which I command you today, that Yahweh your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.

item.title: Deuteronomy 29
item.description: v1 These are the words of the covenant which Yahweh commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.

item.title: Deuteronomy 30
item.description: v1 It shall happen, when all these things have come on you, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before you, and you shall call them to mind among all the nations where Yahweh your God has driven you,

item.title: Deuteronomy 31
item.description: v1 Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.

item.title: Deuteronomy 32
item.description: v1 Give ear, you heavens, and I will speak. Let the earth hear the words of my mouth.

item.title: Deuteronomy 33
item.description: v1 This is the blessing with which Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death.

item.title: Deuteronomy 34
item.description: v1 Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that is opposite Jericho.
